meanings.definition: The practice of observing or upholding strict standards of purity or correctness.
meanings.sent1: She followed the purisms of her religion diligently.
meanings.sent2: His purisms in grammar made him a sought-after editor.
meanings.sent3: The chef's purisms in ingredients led to a very bland dish.
meanings.sent4: Her dedication to purisms in art was like a shining beacon in the art world.
meanings.sent5: The purisms in his writing were so clear, they sparkled like diamonds.

meanings.definition: A purist or advocate of purism.
meanings.sent1: As a purisms, he refused to compromise on quality.
meanings.sent2: The purisms argued for traditional methods in architecture.
meanings.sent3: The purisms at the debate club always made sure the rules were followed.
meanings.sent4: She was a purisms in fashion, always choosing classic styles.
meanings.sent5: The purisms' dedication to their cause was unwavering and inspiring.

meanings.definition: The principles or practices of purists.
meanings.sent1: The purisms of the group were evident in their strict adherence to rules.
meanings.sent2: Studying the purisms of the art movement gave her a new perspective.
meanings.sent3: The purisms of the book club made sure everyone read the assigned chapters.
meanings.sent4: The purisms of the organization guided their every decision.
meanings.sent5: The purisms of the team led to their success in the competition.
